snippet.heading: Asteroids are rocky and metallic objects that orbit the Sun but are too small to be considered planets. They are known as minor planets. ... They have been found inside Earth's orbit to beyond Saturn's orbit. Most, however, are contained within a main belt that exists between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter.Asteroids are rocky and metallic objects that orbit the Sun but are too small to be considered planets. They are known as minor planets. ... They have been found inside Earth's orbit to beyond Saturn's orbit. Most, however, are contained within a main beltmain beltThe asteroid belt formed from the primordial solar nebula as a group of planetesimals. Planetesimals are the smaller precursors of the protoplanets. Between Mars and Jupiter, however, gravitational perturbations from Jupiter imbued the protoplanets with too much orbital energy for them to accrete into a planet.https://en.wikipedia.org › wiki › Asteroid_beltAsteroid belt - Wikipedia that exists between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter.

meta_description.text: Asteroids, sometimes called minor planets, are rocky remnants left over from the early formation of our solar system about 4.6 billion years ago.

people_also_ask.question: What are asteroids made of?
people_also_ask.heading: They probably consist of clay and silicate rocks, and are dark in appearance. They are among the most ancient objects in the solar system. The S-types ("stony") are made up of silicate materials and nickel-iron. The M-types are metallic (nickel-iron).

snippet_data: Asteroids are leftovers of the early Solar System.
Asteroids are made of different things.
We have flown by, orbited and even landed on asteroids.

people_also_ask.question: When was the last time Earth was hit by an asteroid?
people_also_ask.heading: 66 million years ago
people_also_ask.heading2: The last known impact of an object of 10 km (6 mi) or more in diameter was at the Cretaceous–Paleogene extinction event 66 million years ago.The last known impact of an object of 10 km (6 mi) or more in diameter was at the Cretaceous–Paleogene extinction eventextinction eventAn extinction event (also known as a mass extinction or biotic crisis) is a widespread and rapid decrease in the biodiversity on Earth. Such an event is identified by a sharp change in the diversity and abundance of multicellular organisms. ... Extinction occurs at an uneven rate.https://en.wikipedia.org › wiki › Extinction_eventExtinction event - Wikipedia 66 million years ago.
people_also_ask.title: Impact event - Wikipedia

people_also_ask.question: Where do asteroids come from?
people_also_ask.heading: Where did asteroids come from? Asteroids are left over from the formation of our solar system. Our solar system began about 4.6 billion years ago when a big cloud of gas and dust collapsed. When this happened, most of the material fell to the center of the cloud and formed the sun.
people_also_ask.title: What Is an Asteroid? | NASA Space Place

knowledge_panel.description: an asteroid is a minor planet of the inner solar system. historically, these terms have been applied to any astronomical object orbiting the sun that did not resolve into a disc in a telescope and was not observed to have characteristics of an active comet such as a tail. wikipedia
